summary: ELL-associated factor 2 gene, EAF2, and its EAF1 homologue were originally identified as binding partners of ELL (11–19 lysine-rich leukemia), a fusion protein associated with myeloid leukemia (1, 2). Moreover, EAF2 could bind to pVHL, a classic tumor suppressor, and enhances pVHL protein stability (5). we found that EAF2 attenuates TGF- signaling and specifically interacts with Smad3 in vitro and in vivo but not with other Smad proteins. we found that EAF2 impairs Smad3 nuclear translocation, disrupts Smad3-Smad4 complex formation, and prevents binding of p300 to Smad3. Mv1Lu cells were cultured in minimum essential medium (Hyclone) with 10% FBS. all cells were grown at 37 °C in a humidified incubator containing 5% CO2. anti-PAI-1 (ser(P)-423/425) antibody was purchased from Epitomics. anti-PAI-1 (612025) antibody was purchased from BD Transduction Laboratories. for endogenous co-immunoprecipitation, the experimental procedures have been described previously (7). for endogenous co-immunoprecipitation, the experimental procedures have been described previously (7). cells were infected with EAF2 or control lentivirus and treated with TGF- (2 ng/ml) for 20 h. cells were counted by TC-20 cell counter (Bio-Rad) after Giemsa staining. DMEM supplemented with sodium pyruvate, 10% FBS, 0.1 mmol/liter non-essential amino acids and 1% penicillin/streptomycin. all cells were grown at 37 °C in a humidified incubator containing 5% CO2. human EAF2, Smad7, and Smad3 genes were subcloned into pGEX-2T vector. anti-HA antibody was purchased from Santa Cruz. anti-tubulin (EPR1333), anti-Smad2 (EP784Y), anti-Smad3 (EP568Y) and anti-Smad3 (EP823Y) antibody was purchased from Epitomics. anti-c-Myc antibody and anti-HA antibody-conjugated agarose beads were purchased from Sigma. Glutathione S-transferase (GST)-Bind resin was purchased from Novogen. the cells were washed with PBS and homogenized with a syringe for 2 h. the pellet was saved as the crude nuclei, then washed twice with 500 l of NER buffer provided by the kit. the protein levels were detected by Western blot. 93T and HepG2 cell lines were cultured in DMEM (Hyclone) with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS) MDA-MB-231 cells were cultured in L15 (Hyclone) with 10% FBS. all cells were grown at 37 °C in a humidified incubator containing 5% CO2. anti-myc (9E10), anti-GAPDH (sc-47724), anti-p21 (C-19), anti-His (H-15), anti-p300 (F-4), and anti-Smad4 (B-8) antibodies were purchased from Santa Cruz. anti-FLAG (F1804) antibody was purchased from Sigma. the data are reported as the mean S.E. of three independent experiments performed in triplicate. co-immunoprecipitation and Western Blot Analysis. the cells were treated with vehicle control (PBS) or TGF- (2 ng/ml) for 2 h. then the cells were washed with PBS and homogenized with a syringe. the pellet was saved as the crude nuclei, which was then washed twice with 500 l of NER buffer provided by the kit. the protein levels were detected by Western blot. Smad3 in EAF2-null (EAF2/) MEF cells was inhibited by overexpression of the full-length (p 0.0001) and the region of exon V-VI of EAF2 (p = 0.0006) but not by overexpression of the region of exon I-IV of EAF2. overexpression of full-length and domain of exons V-VI of human EAF2 inhibited Smad3 transcriptional activity. however, overexpression of only exons I-IV of EAF2 did not result in inhibition. together, these results suggest that inhibition of TGF- signaling by EAF2 might result from suppression of Smad3 transcriptional activity by EAF2 through a direct Smad3-EAF2 interaction. heximide EAF2 was expressed relatively lower in the prostate epithelium. but Smad3 expression was relatively higher in the same region (n = 3). this suggests that EAF2 might attenuate TGF- signaling by preventing Smad3 nuclear translocation. both Smad3 alone and Smad3-Smad4 combination was inhibited by overexpression of EAF2 in HEK293T cells. knockdown of EAF2 by EAF2-shRNA-2 in HaCaT cells enhanced endogenous Smad3 binding to Smad4. cipitation assays suggest that EAF2 binding disrupts Smad3-Smad4 complex formation and impairs p300 recruitment to Smad3. A1, the transactivity of Smad3 stimulated by TGF- was inhibited by overexpression of EAF2 in HepG2 cells. the cells were stimulated with TGF- (2 ng/ml) for 2h before analysis. treatment, overexpression of EAF2 in haCaT cells had no obvious effect on cell cycle. growth rate of EAF2 wild type MEF cells (EAF2+/+) was higher than that of EAF2-null MEF cells (EAF2/) AF2-null MEF cells (EAF2/) were migrated as compared with EAF2 wild type MEF cells (EAF2+/+) without TGF- treatment, no significant difference was observed in migration between EAF2 wild type MEF cells and EAF2-null MEF cells. EAF2 may represent a specific repressor of TGF- signaling solely through its effect on Smad3 activity. phosphorylation of R-Smads mediated by type I TGF receptors is a relatively early, critical step in the activation of TGF- signaling. however, the inhibitory role of EAF2 on TGF- signaling does not result from its effect on the level of TGF-induced phosphorylation of Smad3. the function of TGF- signaling in tumorigenesis is paradoxical. however, the underlying mechanisms remain largely unknown. in the absence of TGF-, overexpression of EAF2 could actually suppress cell growth. hydrophobic corridor within the MH2 domain of Smad3 was found to be necessary for association with CAN/Nup214 and nuclear import. a similar explanation has been proposed for the effects of orphan nuclear receptor and SARS-CoV N protein on Smad3-mediated TGF- signaling. TGIF, SIP1, SNIP1, AKT, Erbin, and Zili have been shown to interact with, as well as inhibit, Smad protein transcriptional activities by interfering with the ability of CBP/p300 to interact with Smad proteins. a mechanism for EAF2 in the inhibition of TGF- signaling appears to act through disruption of p300 binding to Smad3. the way that EAF2 participate in these pathways is still unclear. phosphorylation of R-Smads mediated by type I TGF- receptors is a relatively early, critical step in the activation of TGF- signaling. however, the inhibitory role of EAF2 on TGF- signaling does not result from its effect on the level of TGF-induced phosphorylation of Smad3. in the absence of TGF-, overexpression of EAF2 could actually suppress cell growth. this is a discrepancy for EAF2 tumor suppressive function. in the absence of TGF-, overexpression of EAF2 could actually suppress cell growth. a similar explanation has been proposed for the effects of orphan nuclear receptor and SARS-CoV N protein on Smad3-mediated TGF- signaling. a number of repressors have been shown to interact specifically with Smad proteins and to increase their transcriptional activities by enhancing CBP/p300 binding. EAF2 binds to the MH2 domain of Smad3, a region implicated in CBP/p300 binding, and inhibits Smad3 transcriptional activity directly. another mechanism for EAF2 in the inhibition of TGF- signaling appears to act through disruption of p300-Smad3 binding to Smad3. binding partners involved in TGF-induced phosphorylation are often examined first (10) however, the inhibitory role of EAF2 on TGF- signaling does not result from its effect on the level of TGF-induced phosphorylation of Smad3. several Smad3-specific associated proteins have been identified, which also affects TGF- signaling. genesis, TGF- signaling promotes cancer cell progression by modulating processes such as epithelial-mesenchymal transition, evasion of immunity, and metastasis (9, 10). in the absence of TGF-, overexpression of EAF2 could actually suppress cell growth. further investigation of this phenomenon might shed new light on the function of EAF2 in tumor suppression. the association of Smad3 with Smad4 has been proposed to be essential for the activation of TGF- signaling (8–10). a similar explanation has been proposed for the effects of orphan nuclear receptor and SARS-CoV N protein on Smad3-mediated TGF- signaling. a region implicated in CBP/p300 binding inhibits Smad3 transcriptional activity directly. another mechanism for EAF2 in the inhibition of TGF- signaling appears to act SnoN, TGIF, SIP1, SNIP1, AKT, Erbin, and Zili have been shown to interact with, as well as inhibit Smad protein transcriptional activities. a mechanism for EAF2 in the inhibition of TGF- signaling
